pt.ua.dicoogle.sdk

Interface PluginSet

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.xeoh.plugins.base.Plugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultFileStoragePlugin, PluginBase

    public interface PluginSet
extends net.xeoh.plugins.base.Plugin
    This is the class responsible for creating a Dicoolge plugin. The developer may use this interface in order to manage and expose the implemented plugins. One instance of each installed plugin set is created by injecting it as a net.xeoh.plugins.base.annotations.PluginImplementation. All instances are expected to be thread safe. It is highly recommended that provided collections are immutable, and that no modifications are performed in getter methods.
    Author:
    psytek, Luís A. Bastião Silva , Eduardo Pinho

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      Gets the indexer plugins enclosed in this plugin set.
      default Collection<? extends JettyPluginInterface> getJettyPlugins()
      Obtains a collection of Jetty plugins, so as to implement web services via Dicoogle.
      String getName()
      Gets the plugin's name.
      default Collection<? extends QueryInterface> getQueryPlugins()

      Gets the storage plugins enclosed in this plugin set.
      void setSettings(ConfigurationHolder xmlSettings)
      Defines the plugin's settings.
      default void shutdown()
      Signals a plugin to stop.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the plugin's name. This name will be used for identifying index/query/storage providers, and should be unique among the total plugin sets installed.
        Returns:
        the name of the plugin, never changes

      • getIndexPlugins

        default Collection<? extends IndexerInterface> getIndexPlugins()
        Gets the indexer plugins enclosed in this plugin set. This collection must be immutable.
        Returns:
        IndexPluginInterface returns a list of active index plugins
        See Also:
        IndexerInterface

      • getQueryPlugins

        default Collection<? extends QueryInterface> getQueryPlugins()
        Gets the query plugins enclosed in this plugin set. This collection must be immutable.
        Returns:
        a collection of query plugins
        See Also:
        QueryInterface

      • getStoragePlugins

        default Collection<? extends StorageInterface> getStoragePlugins()
        Gets the storage plugins enclosed in this plugin set. This collection must be immutable.
        Returns:
        Collection holding the StoragePlugins of this PluginSet

      • getRestPlugins

        default Collection<? extends org.restlet.resource.ServerResource> getRestPlugins()
        Obtains a collection of access to the RESTful resources. These plugins will be installed to the web service hierarchy according to a name defined by the object's toString() method. This collection must be immutable.
        Returns:
        a collection of Restlet-based server resources, implementing toString() to provide the resource name

      • getJettyPlugins

        default Collection<? extends JettyPluginInterface> getJettyPlugins()
        Obtains a collection of Jetty plugins, so as to implement web services via Dicoogle. This collection must be immutable.
        Returns:
        a collection of Jetty plugins to the core application
        See Also:
        JettyPluginInterface

      • setSettings

        void setSettings(ConfigurationHolder xmlSettings)
        Defines the plugin's settings. This method will be called once after the plugin set was instantiated with plugin-scoped settings. Dicoogle users can modify these settings by accessing the XML file with the same name in the "Settings" folder. Developers may define such settings programmatically from the plugin itself.
        Parameters:
        xmlSettings - an XML-based configuration holder

      • getSettings

        ConfigurationHolder getSettings()
        Retrieves the plugin's settings.
        Returns:
        an XML-based configuration holder

      • shutdown

        default void shutdown()
        Signals a plugin to stop. Upon an invocation of this method, the plugin may clean allocated resources and save state if required.
